name: Lubbock COVID Notebook
desc: Examining and tracking the COVID rates in my city.

name: AJV types
desc: Types and factory functions for building AJV validation schemas

name: Redis Objects
desc: Redis library that handles structures as local objects

name: Abstrakt
desc: Abstrakt time-tracking project

name: DangerLINQ
desc: Linq in TypeScript, but every function is compiled from a Github Gist on the fly.

name: SVG Polygon Generator
desc: Generate SVG elements for n-sided regular polygons.

name: Cellular automata generator
desc: Generate cellular automata in your browser!

name: mk-icons-vs-code
desc: Mortal Kombat icons for Visual Studio Code.

name: Merriman
desc: Media server running on Node. Uses TypeScript and React w/ JSX.

name: marie-kondo
desc: A very dangerous CLI app which recursively deletes random files from a given directory.

name: JSON DB
desc: A repo I use to teach some of the base Node modules such as path and fs as well as basic API design considerations.

name: eulers-method-hs
desc: An implementation of Euler's method for approximating the point-set solution of an ordinary first-order differential equation.

name: eulers-method
desc: Same as eulers-method-hs above except written in JavaScript.

name: Impractical Fizzbuzz Solutions
desc: A project created purely to help with first-time open source contributors. An interesting repo to look at when considering how people approach problem solving.

name: Linked List
desc: Yet another implementation of the linked list data structure. Used to help teach the linked list structure.

name: New C# Features
desc: A bunch of examples of newer (7.0+) C# features. Used to show newer features to teammates during team meetings/learning sessions.

name: ShittyLINQ
desc: Extension methods for IEnumerable based on System.Linq in the .NET framework. Created to help first-time open source contributors make their first contributions during Hacktoberfest.

name: ShittyLINQ.js
desc: Methods for Array.prototype based on System.Linq in the .NET framework. Despite the goofy name, this library has near-complete parity with System.Linq! Created to help first-time open source contributors make their first contributions during Hacktoberfest.

name: number-partition
desc: Partition a number into an array of smaller numbers which sum to the original number.

name: fish-operator
desc: The fish operators for composing Kleisli arrows. Resembles the (>=>) and (<=<) operators from Haskell.

name: Days since a loop has been written by...
desc: How many days has it been since I've written a loop?

name: ridiculous-moon-event
desc: Generate a ridiculous name for an otherwise ordinary moon.
